results.title: Learning to swim with artifical aids
results.brief_description: A teacher shows children what they can do with swimming aids. Elementary versions of breast, front and back crawl strokes are introduced. The flipper-float method is also shown on both the back and the front.

results.title: Learning to read maps. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Acorn Films and David Jay
results.brief_description: A mimed fantasy about a lost clown who helps children understand the usefulness of maps. Teaches students that maps are graphic representations of real places, how to recognize symbols representing physical features on maps, how to find directions without using a compass and how to calculate distances to a destination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Acorn Films and David Jay

results.title: Learning to lose
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at criticism of the English educational system which maintains that its emphasis on theory over practical skills leaves students less employable. Shows some alternative programs which have succeeded.

results.title: Learning to live
results.brief_description: During the 1930s Britain was gradually replacing her old,out-dated unhealthy schools with modern well-equipped, fully staffed new schools. Examples of the kind of nursery school, junior school, and senior school which the New Education Act was designed to make the rule rather than the exception throughout Britain, are studied in this film; emphasis is placed on the type of syllabus being taught and the kind of skills being developed in school children in these schools.
results.description: During the 1930s Britain was gradually replacing her old,out-dated unhealthy schools with modern well-equipped, fully staffed new schools. Examples of the kind of nursery school, junior school, and senior school which the New Education Act was designed to make the rule rather than the exception throughout Britain, are studied in this film; emphasis is placed on the type of syllabus being taught and the kind of skills being developed in school children in these schools.

Examples of the kind of nursery school, junior school, and senior school which the New Education Act was designed to make the rule rather than the exception throughout Britain, are studied in this film; emphasis is placed on the type of syllabus being taught and the kind of skills being developed in school children in these schools.

results.title: Learning to dive. Part 3. Advanced diving
results.brief_description: The progressive stages in learning to dive, the preliminary exercises and the way to gain proficiency. Demonstrated by a class of children aged 8-14 years. Part three: a class of children carry out limbering up exercises on land and then instructed in and perform the following five basic acrobatic dives; the forward somersault dive, the back dive, the back-front dive, the reverse dive, the half-twisting dive.
